<ce:section-title>Syntheses of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>[Sm<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(op)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The mixture of Sm<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.035<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), <ce:italic>o</ce:italic>-phthalic acid (0.05<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (16.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) was sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C and kept at constant temperature for 72<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless block crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were obtained (yield: 37% based on the initial Sm<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> input). Elemental <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: C, 35.54; H, 1.74. Found: C, 35.73; H, 1.65%. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, KBr): 3454(w), 3064(w), 1635(m), 1608(s), 1556(vs), 1497(m), 1443(s), 1371(s), 1151(w), 1086(w), 845(m), 744(m), 715(m), 698(m), 652(w), 590(m), 550(m), 449(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{[La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(op)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(ox)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The mixture of La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.065<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), <ce:italic>o</ce:italic>-phthalic acid (0.083<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.025<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (16.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) was sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 180<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C and kept at constant temperature for 72<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were obtained (yield: 35% based on the initial La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> input). Elemental <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: C, 27.57; H, 2.31. Found: C, 27.41; H, 2.20%. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, KBr): 3356(m), 1659(s), 1626(m), 1520(s), 1493(s), 1454(m), 1423(s), 1404(s), 1306(m), 1151(w), 1090(w), 876(w), 849(m), 793(m), 777(m), 710(m), 658(w), 584(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{[Sm<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(op)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(ox)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>

The colourless crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> afforded with the yield about 45% based on the initial Sm<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> input. Elemental <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>: C, 26.79; H, 2.25. Found: C, 26.58; H, 2.17%. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, KBr): 3576(m), 3334(s), 1664(s), 1628(m), 1581(m), 1522(s), 1497(s), 1456(s), 1431(s), 1410(s), 1311(m), 1151(w), 1092(w), 879(m), 852(m), 796(m), 775(s), 712(m), 658(m), 534(m), 447(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{[La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(mp)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(ox)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The procedure was the same as that of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> except that <ce:italic>o</ce:italic>-phthalic acid was replaced by the corresponding <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-phthalic acid. The colourless crystals of <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> afforded with the yield about 35% based on the initial La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> input. Elemental <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for <ce:bold>4</ce:bold>: C, 26.95; H, 2.51. Found: C, 26.87; H, 2.45%. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, KBr): 3515(vs), 1649(s), 1614(s), 1564(s), 1527(vs), 1458(m), 1452(s), 1396(vs), 1315(m), 1188(w), 1167(w), 924(w), 829(w), 802(w), 752(w), 712(m), 542(w), 420(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title>[La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(op)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(mp)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>5</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">The mixture of La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.016<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.05<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), La(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0433<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-phthalic acid (0.017<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), <ce:italic>o</ce:italic>-phthalic acid (0.034<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (16.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) was sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C and kept at constant temperature for 72<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless crystals of <ce:bold>5</ce:bold> were obtained (yield: 30% based on the initial La<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> and La(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O input). Elemental <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for <ce:bold>5</ce:bold>: C, 34.23; H, 2.39. Found: C, 34.18; H, 2.45%. IR data (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>, KBr): 3610(w), 3431(m), 3196(w), 1601(m), 1531(vs), 1491(m), 1421(s), 1406(s), 1392(s), 1375(s), 1149(w), 1086(w), 874(w), 841(w), 750(m), 698(w), 652(w), 596(w), 424(w).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Syntheses of the complexes

[Sm2(op)3(H2O)] n  (1)

The mixture of Sm2O3 (0.035g, 0.1mmol), o-phthalic acid (0.05g, 0.3mmol) and H2O (16.0ml) was sealed in a 25ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 160°C and kept at constant temperature for 72h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless block crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: 37% based on the initial Sm2O3 input). Elemental Anal. Calc. for 1: C, 35.54; H, 1.74. Found: C, 35.73; H, 1.65%. IR data (cm-1, KBr): 3454(w), 3064(w), 1635(m), 1608(s), 1556(vs), 1497(m), 1443(s), 1371(s), 1151(w), 1086(w), 845(m), 744(m), 715(m), 698(m), 652(w), 590(m), 550(m), 449(w).

{[La2(op)2(ox)(H2O)4]⋅H2O} n  (2)

The mixture of La2O3 (0.065g, 0.2mmol), o-phthalic acid (0.083g, 0.5mmol), H2C2O4 ⋅2H2O (0.025g, 0.2mmol) and H2O (16.0ml) was sealed in a 25ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 180°C and kept at constant temperature for 72h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless crystals of 2 were obtained (yield: 35% based on the initial La2O3 input). Elemental Anal. Calc. for 2: C, 27.57; H, 2.31. Found: C, 27.41; H, 2.20%. IR data (cm-1, KBr): 3356(m), 1659(s), 1626(m), 1520(s), 1493(s), 1454(m), 1423(s), 1404(s), 1306(m), 1151(w), 1090(w), 876(w), 849(m), 793(m), 777(m), 710(m), 658(w), 584(w).

{[Sm2(op)2(ox)(H2O)4]⋅H2O} n  (3)

The procedure was the same as that of 2 except that La2O3 was replaced by the corresponding Sm2O3. The colourless crystals of 3 afforded with the yield about 45% based on the initial Sm2O3 input. Elemental Anal. Calc. for 3: C, 26.79; H, 2.25. Found: C, 26.58; H, 2.17%. IR data (cm-1, KBr): 3576(m), 3334(s), 1664(s), 1628(m), 1581(m), 1522(s), 1497(s), 1456(s), 1431(s), 1410(s), 1311(m), 1151(w), 1092(w), 879(m), 852(m), 796(m), 775(s), 712(m), 658(m), 534(m), 447(w).

{[La2(mp)2(ox)(H2O)4]⋅2H2O} n  (4)

The procedure was the same as that of 2 except that o-phthalic acid was replaced by the corresponding m-phthalic acid. The colourless crystals of 4 afforded with the yield about 35% based on the initial La2O3 input. Elemental Anal. Calc. for 4: C, 26.95; H, 2.51. Found: C, 26.87; H, 2.45%. IR data (cm-1, KBr): 3515(vs), 1649(s), 1614(s), 1564(s), 1527(vs), 1458(m), 1452(s), 1396(vs), 1315(m), 1188(w), 1167(w), 924(w), 829(w), 802(w), 752(w), 712(m), 542(w), 420(w).

[La2(op)2(mp)(H2O)4] n  (5)

The mixture of La2O3 (0.016g, 0.05mmol), La(NO3)3 ⋅6H2O (0.0433g, 0.1mmol), m-phthalic acid (0.017g, 0.1mmol), o-phthalic acid (0.034g, 0.1mmol) and H2O (16.0ml) was sealed in a 25ml stainless-steel reactor with Teflon liner and heated to 160°C and kept at constant temperature for 72h, then cooled to room temperature, and the colourless crystals of 5 were obtained (yield: 30% based on the initial La2O3 and La(NO3)3 ⋅6H2O input). Elemental Anal. Calc. for 5: C, 34.23; H, 2.39. Found: C, 34.18; H, 2.45%. IR data (cm-1, KBr): 3610(w), 3431(m), 3196(w), 1601(m), 1531(vs), 1491(m), 1421(s), 1406(s), 1392(s), 1375(s), 1149(w), 1086(w), 874(w), 841(w), 750(m), 698(w), 652(w), 596(w), 424(w).
